intro: Foetidia pterocarpa, commonly known as the African horned melon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces distinctive, spiky, green fruits that turn orange when mature. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with five petals. The fruit is edible, though its thick, bumpy rind and sharp spines make it challenging to handle.
